account: P / The Om Spa | Account-01 / USD [OWN]

checks.name: Conversion actions defined
checks.finding: 6 conversion actions configured. Without conversion tracking, Google cannot optimize bids, and all campaign data becomes unreliable for decision-making.

checks.name: Enhanced conversions enabled
checks.finding: Not enabled — with only 197 conversions/month, every lost signal significantly degrades bid optimization. Enhanced Conversions uses hashed first-party data (email, phone) to recover 5-15% of conversions lost to cookie restrictions. Enable in Google Ads > Goals > Conversions > Settings.

checks.name: Server-side tracking
checks.finding: No server-side tracking detected. Browser-based tracking misses 10-25% of conversions due to ad blockers, ITP, and cookie restrictions. Implement server-side GTM or Google Ads API conversion imports to close this data gap and give Smart Bidding more accurate signals.

checks.name: Consent Mode v2 (EU/EEA)
checks.finding: EU targeting unclear from available data. If targeting EU/EEA users, Consent Mode v2 is legally required since March 2024 and enables conversion modeling for consenting users.

checks.name: Conversion window appropriate
checks.finding: 6 conversion categories detected (1x PHONE_CALL_LEAD, 1x PURCHASE, 1x DEFAULT, 1x CONTACT, 1x PAGE_VIEW, 1x STORE_VISIT). Verify the conversion window matches your sales cycle — high-ticket items need 60-90 day windows, while impulse purchases only need 7-30 days.

checks.name: Micro vs macro separation
checks.finding: Good separation — only macro conversions (purchases, leads, calls) are set as Primary. This ensures Smart Bidding optimizes for real business outcomes, not inflated micro-actions.

checks.name: Attribution model
checks.finding: Cannot verify attribution model via API. Google now defaults to data-driven attribution which uses machine learning to distribute credit. Verify in Settings > Conversions that data-driven is selected for primary actions.

checks.name: Conversion value assignment
checks.finding: No primary actions to assess.

checks.name: No duplicate counting
checks.finding: Potential duplicates found: 3x "call" actions. Duplicate tracking inflates conversion counts by 2-3x, making CPA appear artificially low and causing Smart Bidding to overbid. Remove duplicates and keep only one source per conversion type (prefer GA4 over tag-based tracking).

checks.name: GA4 linked and flowing
checks.finding: GA4 conversion actions detected and linked. GA4 provides cross-device tracking, better attribution modeling, and audience data that improves targeting across campaigns.

checks.name: Google Tag firing
checks.finding: 6 active actions recording 197 conversions in 30d. Tags are firing and data is flowing.

checks.name: Search term audit recency
checks.finding: Active search campaigns detected — search terms should be reviewed weekly. Google matches queries broadly, and without regular reviews, 20-40% of spend typically goes to irrelevant searches. Check Insights > Search Terms for the last 7 days and add negatives for any non-converting, irrelevant terms.

checks.name: Negative keyword lists exist
checks.finding: 2 list(s) with 269 total keywords. Need at least 3 themed lists (e.g., Competitors, Job Seekers, Irrelevant Services) to properly filter traffic. A well-maintained negative list typically saves 15-20% of wasted spend.

checks.name: Account-level negatives applied
checks.finding: Negative keyword lists exist — verify they are applied to ALL active campaigns including Shopping and PMax. Unattached lists provide zero protection. Check Tools > Shared Library > Negative Keyword Lists.

checks.name: Wasted spend on irrelevant terms
checks.finding: Search active — review the Search Terms report for irrelevant queries consuming budget. Sort by cost descending and look for zero-conversion terms with significant spend.

checks.name: Broad match + smart bidding pairing
checks.finding: Verify broad match keywords are paired with Smart Bidding (tROAS or tCPA). Broad match without Smart Bidding causes uncontrolled query expansion and wasted spend. Google's AI needs Smart Bidding to constrain broad match effectively.

checks.name: Close variant pollution
checks.finding: Requires search term report analysis. Close variants can cause exact/phrase match keywords to match unintended queries — review Search Terms for unexpected matches.

checks.name: Search term visibility
checks.finding: Google only shows ~30-40% of actual search terms. Review the visible terms regularly and use scripts or third-party tools to maximize visibility into what queries are triggering your ads.

checks.name: Zero-conversion keywords
checks.finding: Review keywords that have spent more than 2x your target CPA without converting. These should be paused or moved to exact match with lower bids. Zero-conversion keywords are the #1 source of wasted search spend.

checks.name: Campaign naming convention
checks.finding: 2 naming prefix(es) across 4 campaigns. Consistent naming convention in place — makes filtering, reporting, and management significantly easier.

checks.name: Ad group naming convention
checks.finding: 3 total ad groups. Manageable ad group count.

checks.name: Single theme ad groups
checks.finding: Verify each ad group contains tightly themed keywords (STAGs). Mixed themes reduce Quality Score because ad copy cannot match all keywords equally, increasing CPC by 50-400%. Each ad group should target one core intent.

checks.name: Campaign count per objective
checks.finding: 4 campaigns: 2 SEARCH, 2 PERFORMANCE_MAX. Healthy campaign count — sufficient data per campaign for optimization.

checks.name: Brand vs Non-Brand separation
checks.finding: CRITICAL: No brand campaign exists. Competitors can bid on your brand name and steal clicks at a low cost. Brand campaigns typically have 30-50x ROAS with $0.50-$1.50 CPCs. Create a dedicated brand Search campaign immediately with exact and phrase match brand keywords.

checks.name: PMax present for eligible accounts
checks.finding: PMax campaign active — provides cross-channel reach (Search, Display, YouTube, Gmail, Maps, Discover) with automated asset optimization. Monitor search term insights to ensure it targets relevant queries.

checks.name: Search + PMax overlap
checks.finding: Both Search and PMax active — PMax takes priority for exact match queries, which can cannibalize Search campaigns. Monitor both carefully, use brand exclusions in PMax, and compare incremental performance.

checks.name: Budget allocation matches priority
checks.finding: 4 active campaign(s), $611/day budget, Search Impression Share 44%. Capturing only 44% of available impressions means 56% of potential customers never see your ads. Consider increasing budget on proven campaigns or consolidating to focus spend.

checks.name: Campaign daily budget vs spend
checks.finding: $611 daily budget, ~$647 actual daily spend. Budget utilization is healthy.

checks.name: Ad schedule configured
checks.finding: Ad schedule review requires campaign-level schedule data. Consider dayparting if conversion rates vary significantly by hour — analyze hourly performance in the Time report.

checks.name: Geographic targeting accuracy
checks.finding: Correctly using "Presence" targeting — ads only shown to people physically in your target locations, minimizing wasted spend on out-of-area users.

checks.name: Network settings
checks.finding: Network settings properly configured — Search campaigns are not leaking budget to Display Network.

checks.name: Quality Score checks
checks.finding: Average QS: 5.2/10 across 11 scored keywords (2 scoring 7+, 3 below 5). Room for improvement — focus on keywords below 5 to reduce CPC. Each QS point improvement typically reduces CPC by 16%.

checks.name: Zero-impression keywords
checks.finding: 1031 keywords configured: 327 BROAD, 704 EXACT. Review keywords with zero impressions in the last 30 days — they may be too restrictive, have low search volume, or be outranked by other keywords in the same ad group. Pause or restructure these to reduce clutter.

checks.name: Keyword-to-ad relevance
checks.finding: Average QS of 5.2 indicates poor keyword-to-ad relevance. Low relevance means your ads don't closely match user intent — restructure ad groups around single themes, include keywords in headlines, and ensure landing pages address the specific search intent.

checks.name: RSA checks
checks.finding: 10 Responsive Search Ads found, 1 with Good/Excellent Ad Strength. Over half of RSAs have Poor/Average Ad Strength. Add more unique headlines (use different angles: features, benefits, urgency, social proof) and ensure each headline brings a different message. Pin sparingly — excessive pinning reduces Google's ability to optimize.

checks.name: PMax asset checks
checks.finding: PMax active — verify each asset group has: 20 images (various aspect ratios), 5 videos (landscape + vertical + square), 5 headlines, 5 long headlines, 5 descriptions, business name, and logo. Incomplete asset groups limit PMax's ability to serve across all Google surfaces and typically reduce performance by 20-40%.

checks.name: Ad copy relevance to keywords
checks.finding: Verify ad headlines include primary keywords. Keyword insertion in headlines improves CTR by 10-15% on average because ads appear more relevant to the searcher's query. Use dynamic keyword insertion (DKI) or manually include top keywords in at least 3 headlines.

checks.name: Ad freshness
checks.finding: 10 total ads across all campaigns. Creative fatigue reduces CTR by 20-40% over time. Test new ad variations every 4-6 weeks — try different value propositions, CTAs, and emotional angles. Always keep a control ad running alongside tests.

checks.name: CTR vs industry benchmark
checks.finding: Account CTR is 4.25%. Acceptable but room for improvement. The all-industry Search average is 6.66% CTR. Improve by: (1) adding more relevant headlines, (2) including keywords in ad copy, (3) using ad extensions to increase ad real estate, (4) tightening keyword targeting.

checks.name: PMax audience signals
checks.finding: PMax active — audience signals guide Google's AI but don't restrict targeting. Add: (1) Customer Match lists from CRM, (2) Website visitors from GA4, (3) In-market segments relevant to your business. Without signals, PMax spends heavily on broad, untargeted traffic.

checks.name: PMax Ad Strength
checks.finding: Check asset group Ad Strength in the PMax campaign. Aim for "Excellent" — add diverse text, image, and video assets. Each additional unique asset gives PMax more combinations to test, improving performance across Google's entire ad network.

checks.name: PMax brand cannibalization
checks.finding: PMax often captures branded search queries, inflating its reported ROAS while cannibalizing your brand Search campaign. Add brand terms as account-level negative keywords for PMax, and compare PMax performance with vs without brand traffic.

checks.name: PMax search themes
checks.finding: Add search themes to guide PMax toward relevant queries. Without themes, PMax may target overly broad or irrelevant searches. Review Insights > Search categories to see what queries PMax is matching and add themes for your highest-value categories.

checks.name: PMax negative keywords
checks.finding: Request account-level negative keywords for PMax through your Google rep or the PMax Negative Keywords feature. Without negatives, PMax can waste spend on irrelevant queries that standard Search campaigns would normally filter out.

checks.name: Smart bidding strategy active
checks.finding: Smart bidding active (TARGET_SPEND, MAXIMIZE_CONVERSION_VALUE, MAXIMIZE_CONVERSIONS, MAXIMIZE_CONVERSION_VALUE). Google's AI adjusts bids in real-time based on 70+ signals including device, location, time, audience, and query intent — something impossible to replicate manually.

checks.name: Budget constrained campaigns
checks.finding: Search Impression Share is 44%. You're only showing for 44% of eligible searches — missing 56% of potential customers. This is the single biggest growth opportunity: increasing budget or improving Quality Score would put your ads in front of significantly more qualified searchers.

checks.name: Manual CPC justification
checks.finding: Using automated bidding — this leverages Google's real-time auction signals for optimal bid management.

checks.name: Sitelink extensions
checks.finding: 43 sitelink asset(s) configured. Sitelinks increase CTR by 10-20% by providing additional links to key pages (pricing, reviews, specific products). They also increase ad real estate, pushing competitors further down the page.

checks.name: Callout extensions
checks.finding: 12 callout asset(s) configured. Callouts highlight key benefits (Free Shipping, 24/7 Support, Price Match) and increase CTR by 5-10%. They require no additional landing pages.

checks.name: Structured snippets
checks.finding: 2 structured_snippet asset(s) configured. Structured snippets showcase product categories, services, or features under standardized headers. They pre-qualify clicks by setting expectations before the user clicks.

checks.name: Image extensions
checks.finding: 116 image asset(s) configured. Image extensions make ads 2-3x more visually prominent on mobile, increasing CTR significantly. Critical for product-based businesses where visual appeal drives clicks.

checks.name: Call extensions
checks.finding: 1 call asset(s) configured. Call extensions add a clickable phone number to ads, essential for businesses where phone calls are a primary conversion action. Phone leads typically convert 30-50% higher than form fills.

checks.name: Audience segments applied
checks.finding: 1 remarketing/audience list(s) configured. Remarketing audiences convert 3-5x higher than cold traffic because they've already shown interest in your business. Ensure these lists are applied to campaigns as observation layers (for bid adjustments) or targeting layers (for RLSA campaigns).

checks.name: Customer Match lists
checks.finding: No Customer Match lists uploaded. Upload your CRM customer email/phone list to: (1) Exclude existing customers from acquisition campaigns (saving 10-15% of budget), (2) Create lookalike audiences for prospecting, (3) Target past buyers with cross-sell offers. Upload via Tools > Shared Library > Audience Manager.

quickWins.action: Implement server-side tracking via server-side GTM or Google Ads API offline conversion import to close the 10-25% data gap caused by ad blockers and browser restrictions.

Create a brand Search campaign: Add exact and phrase match keywords for your brand name. Set budget to capture 95%+ impression share. Brand campaigns typically achieve 30-50x ROAS with $0.50-$1.50 CPCs.
Upload Customer Match list: Export customer emails/phones from your CRM and upload via Tools > Audience Manager > Customer Match. This enables lookalike targeting and existing customer exclusion.

items: Launch a brand Search campaign immediately to protect your branded search terms. Competitors can bid on your brand name at low cost. Create exact + phrase match keywords for your brand name, set a sufficient budget to capture 95%+ impression share. Brand campaigns typically deliver 30-50x ROAS.

Build your audience infrastructure: (1) Create remarketing audiences in GA4 — all visitors (30d), cart abandoners, past converters, high-value page visitors. (2) Upload Customer Match lists from your CRM for lookalike expansion and existing customer exclusion. Remarketing audiences convert 3-5x higher than cold traffic.

Refresh ad creative: Test new headline angles (features vs benefits vs urgency vs social proof), update ad descriptions with current offers, and add all available extensions (sitelinks, callouts, structured snippets, images). Creative testing every 4-6 weeks prevents fatigue-driven CTR decline.

Increase Search Impression Share from 44.06% toward 50%+ on converting campaigns. This is done by increasing budget, improving Quality Score, and consolidating campaigns to focus spend where it performs best.
With 197 conversions/month, you have enough data to scale. Increase budget by 10-15% weekly on campaigns meeting your ROAS/CPA targets. Monitor for 1 week between each increase to ensure stability.
Test Demand Gen campaigns for upper-funnel awareness — these reach users across YouTube, Gmail, and Discover with visually engaging ads, driving new-to-brand traffic at lower CPMs than Search.
Implement server-side tracking via server-side GTM or direct API conversion imports to improve data quality by 10-25%. This ensures Smart Bidding has the most accurate conversion signals possible.
